content.description: Follow very shallow dihedral feature to first bolt. Crux is between 1st and 2nd bolts.
content.protection: 5 bolts to Fixe ring bolt anchors. Please use draws or slings to TR.
content.location: Route is just left of Wynona's Big Brown Beaver in the center of the crag.

content.protection: 3 bolts to Fixe ring bolt anchors.  Please use draws or slings to preserve anchors.
content.location: Route is just right of the large pine tree at the base of the crag.

content.description: Crux is between 1st and 2nd bolts. Start just right of loose flake below first bolt. Be careful, flake will eventually break off. Follow nice lizard skin to anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts to Fixe ring bolt anchors.  Please use draws or slings to preserve anchors
content.location: route starts just right of Lil Cruzer

content.description: The crux moves are getting off the ground and between the 2nd and 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to Fixe ring bolt anchors. Please use draws or slings when TRing.
content.location: Left most route on the crag. Start slightly right of the first bolt and follow vertical ramp feature.

content.description: Crux is in lower section of climb.
content.protection: 6 bolts to Fixe ring bolt anchors. Please use draws or slings to TR route.
content.location: route is just right of Fish On

content.description: Slabby start to narrow shelf, then follow the bolt line straight up to the obvious Beaver feature.  The crux is within the first two bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts protect this route.  Some may want a #3 TCU or sling to protect the minor runout between the 3rd and 4th bolts. Lots of chicken heads in this region. Fixe ring bolts for the anchor, but bring draws or slings to protect the anchors from excessive wear.
content.location: Route is straight below the water stained layback Beaver, in the center of the crag.

content.description:
Fun, south facing, ~100ft tall crag next to the Wilderness of Rock trail.  Easy/Moderate sport climbing on good quality granite. Cliff becomes low angle at top of routes so Fixe ring bolt anchors allow climbers to rappel off. Left most routes can be toproped by hiking around west side of crag and scrambling to the top.  When toproping, please use draws or slings through ring bolts to reduce anchor wear. 

  Located at 8000ft, this is a great crag for warmer weather climbing.
